thread.title: Atletico Madrid's Kevin Gameiro fuels Tottenham transfer talk with angry reaction to substitution
thread.title_full: Atletico Madrid's Kevin Gameiro fuels Tottenham transfer talk with angry reaction to substitution

author: Liam Corless
title: Atletico Madrid's Kevin Gameiro fuels Tottenham transfer talk with angry reaction to substitution
text:
Atletico Madrid's Kevin Gameiro fuels Tottenham transfer talk with angry reaction to substitution Gameiro was withdrawn with 19 minutes to play of Atleti's Champions League clash with Bayer Leverkusen Share Kevin Gameiro was unhappy at being substituted against Bayer Leverkusen (Photo: Maja Hitij)   
Kevin Gameiro's angry reaction to being substituted by Atletico Madrid on Tuesday night will have been music to Tottenham's ears. 
The striker was visibly upset at being taken off in the 71st minute of Atleti's 4-2 win over Bayer Leverkusen in Germany, a match in which he scored the visitors' third goal. 
Mirror Football revealed on Sunday that Atletico are willing to sell Gameiro, 29, in the summer just a year after signing him for Â£35million from Sevilla. 
They have sounded out several clubs, including Spurs who want top-class competition and back up for Harry Kane. 
Gameiro played down his reaction to being withdrawn against Leverkusen, conceding the decision was manager Diego Simeone's to make. Read More Gameiro scored Atletico's third goal in Germany (Photo: Maja Hitij) The striker has struggled on the whole since moving to Atletico (Photo: Maja Hitij) Spurs want a striker capable of challenging or pairing up with first-choice forward Harry Kane (Photo: REUTERS) 
"Yes, I was angry because you want to play the whole match when you're playing well," Gameiro said, according to Marca. 
"I was a little bit angry, but the most important thing is the team's victory. 
"This is football, where the coach [Diego Simeone] decides and that's that." 
Gameiro has been in poor form since moving to the Vicente Calderon but has scored four times in his last two appearances to move onto 13 goals for the season in all competitions. poll loading Would Kevin Gameiro be a good signing for Tottenham? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
